assign2.ngram

Interface NGramMap


  • public interface NGramMap

    Interface that supports a collection of ngrams, each held in an object of type NGramContainer. The Abstract model of the collection is a map, with the context string as the key. Each context string is then able to retrieve its associated container object.

    Note please that there is some abuse of the term NGram in this documentation as a shorthand for an object of type NGramContainer, which has an ngram at the heart, but is really in itself a small collection of possible ngrams.

    The interface specifies methods to allow ngrams to be added to the collection, removed from the collection, and for ngrams to be sourced for a particular context string from an external web source. The approach is based on the service provided here: http://research.microsoft.com/web-ngram, but the specification is reasonably generic, and so the application keys and other parameters are regarded as implementation issues and not specified here.

    You must implement this interface as class NGramStore, and produce a comprehensive unit test suite for it. While a professional interface would not normally specify the constructors to be used, here for convenience you are instructed to implement only a simple parameterless constructor for class NGramStore.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    hogan

    • Method Detail

      • addNGram

        void addNGram(NGramContainer ngram)
        (Silently) Add an ngram to the Map. If the context does not exist in the Map, the entry is added.
        If the context exists in the Map, then the associated ngram is updated.
        Parameters:
        ngram - - ngram to be added

      • removeNGram

        void removeNGram(java.lang.String context)
        (Silently) Remove an ngram from the Map. If the context does not exist in the Map, the entry is not removed, but no status is returned.
        If the context exists in the Map, then the associated ngram is removed.
        Parameters:
        context - - context string for ngram to be removed

      • getNGram

        NGramContainer getNGram(java.lang.String context)
        Find the NGram associated with the context if it exists in the Map. Return null if the context is not a key in the Map.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        NGramContainer associated with the context or null

      • getNGramsFromService

        boolean getNGramsFromService(java.lang.String context,
                           int maxResults)
                             throws NGramException
        Get the top maxResults ngrams returned from the service.
        Parameters:
        context - - the context for the ngram search
        maxResults - - the maximum number of
        Returns:
        true and store the NGram in the Map if the service returns at least one result
        return false and do not store the bare context if the service returns no predictions
        Throws:
        NGramException - if the service fails to connect or if the NGramContainer cannot be created.

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
